SUBJECT:
Fourth Quarterly Stewardess
Meetings - La Guardia
The fourth quarterly stewardess meetings were held on December 16, 17, and 18 at
9:00 A.M.
The first part of the meetings took place in the Conference Room of United's Hangar
#2 where there was a general discussion and showing os emergency slides.
Each girl
filled out the Stewardess Survey Questionnaire.
Elaine Mower expounded on the in-
portance of the stewardesses
on the plancs being seated with seat belts fastened
before landings and take-offs.
The
sccond part of the mecting consisted of cmergency evacuation procedures from a
DC-6 in the hangar.
Edith Lautcrbach gavo a thorough discussion on cmergency proced-
ures before the girls evacuated from the planc.
All the girls jumped into the chute
first, then usod the oxit at scat 5A and slid
down the wing.
Edith Lauterbach then
acted as first stewardess with the girls as her passongers in an imaginary flight
ready to make an cmorgency landing. She rolayed the information to her passengers,
telling them what to do.
The girls acted accordinely bofore and during evacuation.
The actual ovacuation of using two exits, 5A and the main cabin door was timed.
girls did very well and learned much.
The
At 12:30 thoy proceeded to a private room in the terminal building where
they were
served a Christnas luncheon.
Each girl took a pift from the grab-bag; pictures were
taken; corsages given out; and everyone ate lavishly.
Credit is due to Chef Salzmann who prepared the special lunch and San Iaquinto,
Supervisor of the Commissary, who decorated the room.
Our honored guests were Major V. Carson, Manager of La Guardia Airport, Lieutenant
Brady, head of the Port Authority Police Force, and George Marino, Safety Inspector.
We express our thanks and appreciation to Duggan Laird, CYSED, who assisted with the
emergency procedures.
Elaine D. Mower
